page.title: 12COASTLINE S. OF BRIGHSTONE
page.content: A main road runs parallel to the coast called the Military Road.Beyond this the low, flat_topped cliffs stretch towards the sea. They are only 10 to 15 metres high. The cliffs are made of sand and clay. The clay is greyish_blue in colour and called blue slipper clay. The particles of clay are so small that water cannot penetrate easily. This means that anything above the clay can slip off the greasy wet layer of clay and cliff falls are common in this region. The holiday camp has lost half of its land in 40 years.Although this is not real potter's clay you can have fun moulding it and making pots. They crack as the clay dries though. The beach here is narow and nearly covered at high tide. It is made up of sand and pebbles and is not suitable for bathers.
